column4: hi, how do i reinstall xorg? i accidentaly deleted some files
but that didn't seem to do the right things
if i symlink Xorg to X
but if you just delete files dpkg doesn't know that its depencies are missing
ok so how do i get a clean xorg install

here is a list of packages that own files in /usr/lib/X11, try reinstalling them http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_contents.pl?word=%2Fusr%2Flib%2FX11&searchmode=searchfilesanddirs&case=insensitive&version=breezy&arch=i386
hurmm it's a suid/permission problem i think
maybe delete the log and let it recreate it

x works for root now, but not normal user
what error did you get when you try to run x as a user
Cannot move old log file(/var/log/Xorg.log.0" to "/var/log/Xorg.log.0.old")
